title: Greta Thunberg detained at anti-mining protest
material_description: Digital screen recording of @Nowthis Tiktok feed.
brief_description: Since 2018, activist Greta Thunberg has used social media to bring young people into the climate change conversation. Primarily active on Twitter and Instagram, she has organised and documented schools striking for climate action, protests, and sit-ins internationally – and recently sparred online with alt-right social media personality Andrew Tate, a high profile exchange that was interrupted by his arrest on rape and human trafficking charges. This video documenting her detainment at an anti-mining protest in Germany displays Thunberg’s characteristic staunchness, shot through with the impudence that makes her such a compelling campaigner.
description:
This video features in a responsive display in the museum that presents the moments, stories and memes capturing the zeitgeist by going viral on the internet.

Since 2018, activist Greta Thunberg has used social media to bring young people into the climate change conversation. Primarily active on Twitter and Instagram, she has organised and documented schools striking for climate action, protests and sit-ins internationally – and recently sparred online with alt-right influencer Andrew Tate, a high profile exchange that was interrupted by his arrest on human trafficking charges. This video of her detainment at an anti-mining protest in Germany displays Thunberg’s staunchness, shot through with the audacity that makes her such a compelling campaigner.
